slides.title: What is Electrical Engineering?
slides.content:
# Sparks ‚ö°

Study and application of electricity, electronics, and electromagnetism.
- **Power**: Generating/Moving electricity.
- **Electronics**: Controlling electricity (Chips).
- **Signals**: Communication.

slides.title: Circuit Basics
slides.content:
# The Loop ‚≠ï

- **Voltage (V)**: Pressure (Volts).
- **Current (I)**: Flow (Amps).
- **Resistance (R)**: Obstacle (Ohms).
- **Ohm's Law**: $V = I \times R$.

slides.title: Kirchhoff's Laws
slides.content:
# Conservation ‚öñÔ∏è

1. **KCL (Current)**: Current entering a junction = Current leaving.
2. **KVL (Voltage)**: Sum of voltages around any loop is zero.
Base rules for all circuit analysis.

slides.title: Semiconductors
slides.content:
# Silicon Valley üíª

Materials that can switch between conducting and insulating.
- **Doping**: Adding impurities (P-type, N-type).
- **Diode**: One-way valve for current.
- **Transistor**: Digital switch (0 or 1).

slides.title: AC vs DC
slides.content:
# The War of Currents ü•ä

- **DC (Direct Current)**: Battery. Electrons flow one way. Edison.
- **AC (Alternating Current)**: Wall outlet. Electrons wiggle back and forth. Tesla.
- AC is better for long distance transmission.

slides.title: Law Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What is the formula for Ohm's Law?

slides.title: Power Systems
slides.content:
# The Grid üîã

1. **Generation**: Power Plant (12kV).
2. **Step Up**: Transformer (400kV for travel).
3. **Transmission**: High voltage lines.
4. **Step Down**: Substation (11kV).
5. **Distribution**: To your house (240V/120V).

slides.title: Signal Processing
slides.content:
# Filtering Noise üìª

Analyzing and modifying signals (Sound, Radio, Images).
- **Analog**: Continuous wave (Vinyl).
- **Digital**: 0s and 1s (MP3).
- **DAC/ADC**: Converting between them.

slides.title: Control Systems
slides.content:
# Automation üéÆ

Managing behavior of devices.
- **Open Loop**: Toaster (Runs for time, doesn't check if bread is burnt).
- **Closed Loop**: AC (Checks temp, adjusts cooling).
- **PID Controller**: Common algorithm for smooth control.

slides.title: Electric Motors
slides.content:
# Turning Wheels üöó

Using magnetism to create motion.
- **Stator**: Stationary magnets.
- **Rotor**: Spinning coil.
- **Induction Motor**: Workhorse of industry (Tesla cars use this).

slides.title: Transformers
slides.content:
# Voltage Changer ü§ñ

Two coils of wire around a magnetic core.
- Changes Voltage/Current levels using Induction.
- Only works with **AC**.
- Essential for power grid.

slides.title: Capacitors and Inductors
slides.content:
# Energy Storage üîã

- **Capacitor**: Stores energy in Electric Field (Fast burst).
- **Inductor**: Stores energy in Magnetic Field (Resists change in current).

slides.title: Motor Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which part of an electric motor spins?

slides.title: Printed Circuit Boards (PCB)
slides.content:
# Green Boards üü©

Physical platform for circuits.
- **Copper Traces**: Wires printed on board.
- **Solder**: Metal glue connecting components.
- Multi-layered (Phone boards have 10+ layers).

slides.title: Communication Systems
slides.content:
# Connecting üì°

- **Modulation**: Encoding info onto a carrier wave (AM/FM, WiFi).
- **Fiber Optics**: Sending light down glass tubes (Speed of light internet).
- **5G**: High frequency radio waves.

slides.title: Renewable Integration
slides.content:
# Green Grid ‚òÄÔ∏è

Challenge: Sun/Wind aren't constant.
- **Smart Grid**: Two-way communication.
- **Inverters**: Converting DC solar to AC grid.

slides.title: Embedded Electronics
slides.content:
# Microcontrollers üïπÔ∏è

Tiny computers (Arduino, ESP32).
- Interfacing with sensors and actuators.
- Internet of Things (IoT).

slides.title: Electromagnetic Compatibility (EMC)
slides.content:
# No Interference üîá

Ensuring devices don't mess up others nearby.
- Shielding (Metal cages).
- Why you have to turn off phones on planes (mostly usage precaution now).

slides.title: Elec Eng Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- **Ohm's Law** rules all.
- **Transistors** enable computing.
- **AC Power** runs civilization.
- **Electromagnetism** connects us.
